item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, December 19, 2024 at 6:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Postgres as a VectorDB GUI (62 points | 6 comments)
2. Solaar is a Linux manager for many Logitech keyboards, mice, and other devices (332 points | 140 comments)
3. Markov Keyboard: keyboard layout that changes by Markov frequency (9 points | discuss)
4. Alignment faking in large language models (5 points | discuss)
5. Firenvim – Turn the browser into a Neovim client (43 points | 8 comments)
6. Piccolo OS, a Small Multitasking OS for the Raspberry Pi Pico (61 points | 2 comments)
7. Exposing the Clearingstelle Urheberrecht Im Internet (CUII) (33 points | 3 comments)
8. Self-sorting arrays reveal unexpected competencies in minimal intelligence (83 points | 12 comments)
9. Automotive Grade Linux Launches New Expert Group Led by Toyota (44 points | 13 comments)
10. ISO 8583: The language of credit cards (245 points | 39 comments)
11. Cultural Evolution of Cooperation Among LLM Agents (229 points | 113 comments)
12. Tiny Black Holes Could Have Left Tunnels Inside Earth's Rocks (15 points | 6 comments)
13. The RAM Myth (70 points | 29 comments)
14. Launch HN: Innate (YC F24) – Home robots as easy to program as AI agents (129 points | 58 comments)
15. Embedding Lua in Sqleibniz with Rust (43 points | 1 comment)
16. Updates to H-1B (312 points | 871 comments)
17. Our brains create mental "chapters" with new event segmentation study (41 points | 2 comments)
18. Error Stacking in Rust (43 points | 15 comments)
19. Torpedo juice: Legendary, illegal WWII liquor drunk in Alaska and the world (26 points | 12 comments)
20. Half My Life with Perl (70 points | 26 comments)
21. I Built a Figma Plugin That Generates Custom SVG Illustrations with AI (29 points | 11 comments)
22. Apple Watch with Android (141 points | 76 comments)
23. Genesis – a generative physics engine for general-purpose robotics (20 points | 9 comments)
24. Corvus Robotics (YC S18) is hiring a Head of Software to help inventory drones ( | hide)
25. Windshield pitting incidents in Washington reach fever pitch on April 15, 1954 (2003) (267 points | 206 comments)
26. Moon (2851 points | 236 comments)
27. Advanced Civilizations Could Be Indistinguishable from Nature (65 points | 39 comments)
28. Formally Modeling Dreidel, the Sequel (86 points | 22 comments)
29. Java in the Small (227 points | 154 comments)
30. "The Custer Wolf is Dead." (1921) [pdf] (41 points | 7 comments)
